answers.answer: Hi,Thanks for writing in.Most of the bites by a brown recluse spider are mild. There is a necrotizing ulcer at the site of the bite, headache, malaise, nausea and vomiting. The symptoms that you are describing are not the usual symptoms of spider bite. I would suggest you to get yourself screened for peripheral neuropathy due to diabetes, or B12 deficiency and also for peripheral arterial diseases.Take care!

question: I got bit by a brown recluse 15 months ago , went to the Dr. had it lanced it healed in a couple of months,. I thought all was well. one year almost to the day later, I started feeling numbness, my leg would go to sleep alot. I was bitten last June. Since then I can't walk some days, If my leg gets cold it throbs and shuts completely down, it feels like ice water is dripping down it.,bees are inside stinging me, knives are stabbing me, it shoots sharp pains down my leg and throws me to the floor some times, I have no insurance, but have managed to get a doppler ultra sound done the neuro.said I had a mass in my vascular system and sends me to a vascular Dr. in return tells me He truly believes I definetlyhave a toxin in my leg but it is attacking my nerves and muscles not my vascular system. At this point I don't know what to do my Dr. tells me his hands are tied in the mean time I can't work anymore I am in excruciating pain all the time and I am scared of what is going on inside my leg PLEASE CAN SOMEONE HELP ME!!!  I AM BEGGING YOU.
title: I have had numbness,tingling,sharp pains,down my leg from a spider toxin left under my skin
